title: 820-3437 not connecting device.
message:
this machine come in dead. theres something to do with all sys pwrgd not showing, so I remove q8150. now machine turn on.
a few weeks later customer say macbook cannot connect to device. i use my known good cable to my device, its charging but itunes doesnt detect device.
I have discard all part problem, and use my own ssd with big sur. but still doesnt see device. mouse and usb drive works fine at both usb port. any advice ?

title: 820-3437 not connecting device.
message:
the device will show and disconnected, show and disconnected, in the finder. the charging indicator on the device stay charging.
both port behave the same, so im sure this is not a usb port solder joint connection problem

title: 820-3437 not connecting device.
message:
Looks like you have problems with USB 3.0 connection.
Check corresponding protection diodes and series caps.

title: 820-3437 not connecting device.
message:
do you mean the usb3_exta and extb line ?

all diode and caps is good and doesnt have continuity to its other end.

title: 820-3437 not connecting device.
message:
Compare diode mode readings to ground with good board, on all 4 lines.
Also check the value on both sides of the series caps.

title: 820-3437 not connecting device.
message:
i diode mode all that line.
USB3_EXTA_D2R_N
USB3_EXTA_D2R_P
USB3_EXTA_R2D_C_N
USB3_EXTA_R2D_C_P
USB3_EXTA_R2D_N
USB3_EXTA_R2D_P
and the extb one too.

no diode is shorted, the caps all have 0.310 at one side, and O.L at the other side, all good.
is this pch problem?

title: 820-3437 not connecting device.
message:
Very likely.
Check first any USB3 related voltage at page 11, especially L1295.

title: 820-3437 not connecting device.
message:
both L1290 and L1295 have 1.05v at both side of the component. I dont see any related usb 3 thing to check anymore.
can I assume this is pch no fix ?

title: 820-3437 not connecting device.
message:
There may be bad solders, or broken traces.
However, hopeless project...
